title: Judiciary Plans New System for Spotting Financial Conflicts After WSJ Report
sub_head: Chairwoman of the judiciary’s ethics committee stops short of promising an end to long delays in releasing judges’ financial-disclosure forms
body:
The federal judiciary is planning a new electronic financial-disclosure system to spot judges’ conflicts, but the chairwoman of the judiciary’s ethics committee stopped short of promising an end to long delays in getting those reports to the public.
“In some cases the release of reports takes too long,” Judge Jennifer Elrod said in written testimony for a House Judiciary subcommittee hearing Tuesday. She said the judiciary “has been engaged in continuing efforts to develop and implement a new electronic financial disclosure system.”
